American Single

All shows start at 9 pm



**ARTIST FAVORITE AWARD WINNER AT RVK FRINGE 2018**

Swipe right for American Single! Two strangers (one single American girl + one volunteer from the audience) transition from “It’s a Match!” to their first date within a matter of minutes. It’s awkward, it’s taboo, and it is definitely a funny story you’ll be telling your friends later. 

This is an award winning, audience-interactive show, that exists on the border between stand-up, improv, and performance art. Olivia invites the audience to open their phones (and hearts!) by matching with her through a popular dating app, then takes one lucky suitor up onto the stage where they have a REAL FIRST DATE in front of a live audience-- an audience which is offering their every thought and criticism of the date via live poll.  Will they find love? Intimacy? Another one night stand? Every first date is different and entirely unpredictable.

American Single bravely explores the space between the personal and the private, while challenging its viewers to step out of their comfort zones in the name of true love. Can a real, honest connection be found under such artificial circumstances? American Single ventures to find out. 

Reviews

"Question your online dating choices, question your dating habits, but don’t question if you want to see this show. American Single is always a match!"
- Jessica LoMonaco, Fringe Co-Director

"Like watching a bus full of clowns crash into a firework factory: a disaster but still colorful and immensely funny."
- Ingimar Bjarni, Reykjavik Fringe


The Footlight Bar NYC
465 Seneca Ave (off the Seneca M or the Dekalb L) 


Instagram: @American.Single

Doors at 9. $10

Sometimes, we need help. Other times, we want a new challenge. Come to our open forum to get or give tech help on your own projects or on someone else's! These regular events offer a space for a self-directed and social mixer to meet and learn from others, build knowledge and skills in our community, enjoy the anti-consumerist and anti-capitalist vibes that come with DIY workshops, play and teach one another new tricks, or to fix whatever's blocking you from getting shit done on your computer. Come with questions, or come willing to find the answers by exploring with others. At our open forum, please keep in mind our lightweight social rules to help make the space welcoming to people of all skill and experience levels. This event is: Individuals.

Summary: Primitive Heart Birthday Show w/ Grisette, Johnny Butler, Sweet Tea
Description: Primitive Heart, Grisette, Johnny Butler, Sweet Tea Doors at 8. $10 Primitive Heart will be celebrating her birthday at The Footlight in Queens with friends. Primitive Heart (Brooklyn) Primitive Heart is a dreamgaze project by Dani Mari. Dani Mari is a multi-genre music producer and visual artist. Audiences across the world have gravitated toward Dani Mari's beautifully haunting voice and simplistic elegant lyrics. Her ethereal vocals "seemingly casting a spell" and transport listeners to an era of nostalgia which exists within the depths of her soul. primitiveheartmusic.com Grisette (Philly) Grisette is a goddamn rock and roll band. grisetteband.bandcamp.com Johnny Butler (Brooklyn) performing with dancer Nicole von Arx ...Brooklyn-based Johnny Butler turns a polyphony of overdubbed horns (triggered by laptop) into Fritz Lang’s Metropolis machine. — DownBeat Magazine johnnybutler.com Sweet Tea (Brooklyn)

The Queens County Royal Court invites you and your kith and kin, to a most exquisite new Drag Cabaret. Doors 8 PM, $8 Advance, $10 Day of Show With Mavens of Ceremony Junior Mintt and Comrade Barbie, the QCRC aims to showcase queer performers of all genders and backgrounds for our friends and neighbors, in a positive and affordable environment. Conveniently located off the L and M trains, The Footlight Bar of Ridgewood will host this most auspicious occasion, the debut of a decedent four hours’ traffic of our stage. Here, we take the theatrical traditions from the courts of despots and tyrants, “illustrious patrons of the arts,” and claim them for every kind of audience. Here, the trappings of glitz and glam come second to the art of The Show. Many wild performances are promised for all, the likes of which Netflix could never produce. Also! Games, Comedy, and Vendors, featuring the jewelry of neighborhood staple the Prince Peacock. The inaugural event will take place on the 26th of February, with doors opening at 8pm. $8 in advance, $10 at the door. ALL are welcome. For more info follow us @queenscountyroyalcourt on Instagram and Facebook or go to queenscountyroyalcourt.com. Line-up to be announced! BUY TICKETS

Summary: AM I WRITE LADIES? Spring Cleaning
Description: Am I Write, Ladies?: SPRING CLEANING 8pm doors, 8:30pm show $10 ($ goes to the artists!) The Footlight Bar is wheelchair accessible. BUY TICKETS an evening of work from women and gender non-conforming artists about tidying up, clearing emotional baggage, hoarding, juice cleanses, and more featuring comedy, burlesque, music, and other performance from: Lorena Russi Foxy Belle Afriq Amy Lee Emma Howard Leah Vanessa Gonzalez Izzy Okay Tess Wolgemuth Katherine Rose Turbes Wanda Noonan and Megan Gilbert plus art, poems, and printed creations by Tenacity Plys, Isabelle Guillocheau, and more Tuesday, March 5, 2019 At The Footlight Bar 465 Seneca Ave, Ridgewood (L to DeKalb) 8pm doors, 8:30pm show $10 ($ goes to the artists!) The Footlight Bar is wheelchair accessible. Taking place approximately every 3 months, Am I Write, Ladies? is a series created by Cassidy Dawn Graves in 2014 showcasing new and developing work by women and gender non-conforming artists of all disciplines. Associate producing + curation by Sammi Miller. poster design by Jesse Jae Hoon Want to give additional financial support to us + our artists? Do so here: linkwithfriends.co/am_i_write_ladies/join Find us on Instagram: @amiwriteladies

A queer hacker salon in NYC. Features:
  • Livecoding
  • Photobooth
  • Indie games by Death by Audio
  • NES games
  • Music
  • Visuals
  • Local chatrooms
  • Surprise guest project
Feafured Artist
  • Zach Krall
Hex90::init() 03.10.2019 @ The Footlight 465 Seneca Avenue Ridgewood, NY 11385 9pm – 2am
  • This venue is accessible.
  • This venue has gender-neutral restrooms.
Dressing up is encouraged but not required. Cover: $5.00 This space is not exclusionary, but it is an intentionally queer space. Consent and respect are not optional! Anyone being disrespectful will be removed immediately. We are against technocapitalist motives. We are a space for queer hackers, not for Silicon Valley fans. Don't piss off the hackers. ;)
